alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 1:46AM EDT until July 29 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT FOR MONROE COUNTY... At 145 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Britton to near Lambertville to near Holland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Temperance and Lambertville around 150 AM EDT. Ida and Luna Pier around 205 AM EDT. Maybee around 210 AM EDT. Monroe around 220 AM EDT. Carleton around 225 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Newport, Cone, Estral Beach, Erie, South Rockwood, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Bolles Harbor, Samaria and Azalia. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
